div.p: No. 1539, unit 3, p. 148, VPRS 1187 outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

With reference to your Report for June
See M to J. O'Shanassy, July 1858 (inthis edition as 58.07.00b). in which you recommend that the office of "Bailiff" connected with the Garden be abolished I am to inform you that there is no such appointment in the Estimates as that of Bailiff — The man you allude to must be paid as a Gardener or Laborer & as you have the entire control of this class you require no authority from this office to enable you to carry out the arrangement you propose.
